intro: Metrosideros sclerocarpa, commonly known as the kauri pohutukawa, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive red flowers that bloom in winter. The plant has smooth, dark green leaves and produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in coastal and subcoastal regions, often growing on rocky soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is a notable species in New Zealand's flora.
